proposed_strategy.description: The provided text contains only one structural unit (Mundaka 2, Khanda 2). Since the total character count is very small, it is processed as a single chunk.

parsing_instructions.numbering_capture_strategy: Extract the Devanagari numeral found at the very end of the bolded Mantra text line, enclosed by double vertical bars (e.g., || 1 ||).

start_pattern.description: The start of a unit is the bolded primary verse text, which ends with the Devanagari numeral enclosed in double pipes.
examples: **आवि: संनिहितं गुहाचरं नाम महत् पदम्... प्रजानाम् ।।१।।**
**यदर्चिमत् यदणुभ्योऽणु यस्मिन् लोका – निहिता... सोम्य विद्धि ॥२॥**

end_pattern.description: The commentary for a Mantra ends immediately before the start of the next bolded Mantra or the final colophon of the Khaṇḍa/Prakāśikā.

parsing_instructions.pre_content_handling: The initial document title, Mundaka and Khanda headers, and section headings (e.g., [सर्वाधारभूतं ब्रह्म]) should be treated as 'Prefatory' content for the chunk, existing before Mantra 1.
